greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Smallest number with binary run length product = n
example: a(4) = 12, because 12 is the smallest number with a binary run length product of 4.
12 decimal = 1100 binary. Run lengths in binary are 2,2, and 2x2 = 4.
xref: Cf. A167489 - Product of run length in binary representation of n
Cf. A167491 - Numbers in this sequence sorted in ascending order
results.author: _Andrew Weimholt_, Nov 05 2009
